availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Uberto Keenon (Franklin County, Kentucky, clerk and captain 36th enrolled militia (U.S.A.))

body.p: Franklin County, Kentucky, clerk and soldier. Kentucky native. Son of Adam C. Keenon and Elizabeth S. Keenon. Attended school in Franklin County, Kentucky, in 1850. Household owned nineteen enslaved persons in Franklin County in 1850. Clerk in Franklin County in 1859. Clerk in Franklin County in 1863. Clerk in Franklin County in 1864. Served in the 36th Enrolled Militia, First Battalion, Company A (U.S.A.) as a captain from June 8, 1864, to June 18, 1864.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Franklin County, District 2, p. 76A.
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Franklin County, District 2, p. 899.
Annual Report of the Auditor of Public Accounts of the State of Kentucky, for the Fiscal Year Ending October 10, 1859 (Frankfort, KY: Jno. B. Major, State Printer, 1860), 288.
Annual Report of the Auditor of Public Accounts of the State of Kentucky, for the Fiscal Year Ending October 10, 1863, Legislative Documents Series, No. 10 (Frankfort, KY: Wm. E. Hughes, State Printer, 1864), 301.
Report of the Adjutant General of the State of Kentucky, vol. 2, 1861-1866 (Frankfort: Kentucky Yeoman Office, 1866), p. 897-98.
"Uberto Keenon (1839-1920)," Find A Grave, Memorial 88227564, accessed January 30, 2023, http://www.findagrave.com/memorial/88227564.
